dt: {bc}of, relating to, or characteristic of {a_link|legend} or a legend

pt: {sc}fictitious{/sc} {sc}fabulous{/sc} {sc}legendary{/sc} {sc}mythical{/sc} {sc}apocryphal{/sc} mean having the nature of something imagined or invented. {sc}fictitious{/sc} implies fabrication and suggests artificiality or contrivance more than deliberate falsification or deception.
{sc}fabulous{/sc} stresses the marvelous or incredible character of something without necessarily implying impossibility or actual nonexistence.
{sc}legendary{/sc} suggests the elaboration of invented details and distortion of historical facts produced by popular tradition.
{sc}mythical{/sc} implies a purely fanciful explanation of facts or the creation of beings and events out of the imagination.
{sc}apocryphal{/sc} implies an unknown or dubious source or origin or may imply that the thing itself is dubious or inaccurate.

pt.t: a book that repeats many {it}apocryphal{/it} stories

shortdef: of, relating to, or characteristic of legend or a legend
